intro: Lavoisiera confertiflora var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lavoisiera, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its botanical structure makes it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
